intro: Sinosidus albescens var. rugosus, commonly known as the rough-skinned sinosidus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or mountainous habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
